question: Match the following:
column_I: Organisms belonging to the same taxa
column_II: Based on cytological information like chromosome number, structure, behaviour
Based on evolutionary relationships between the various organisms
Uses the chemical constituents of the plant to resolve confusions

answer.Phylogenetic classification systems: Based on evolutionary relationships between the various organisms
answer.Cytotaxonomy: Based on cytological information like chromosome number, structure, behaviour
answer.Chemotaxonomy: Uses the chemical constituents of the plant to resolve confusions

question: Match the following:
column_I: Numerical Taxonomy is easily carried out using
When there is no supporting fossil evidence
column_II: Used to help resolve difficulties in classification

answer.Information from many other sources: Used to help resolve difficulties in classification

question: Match the following:
column_I: Some algae also occur in association with fungi
Some algae occur in association with animals
column_II: Largely aquatic (both fresh water and marine) organisms

answer.Algae are: Largely aquatic (both fresh water and marine) organisms

question: Match the following:
column_II: Flagellated (motile) and on germination gives rise to new plants
By the production of different types of spores

answer.Asexual reproduction in algae: By the production of different types of spores
answer.Zoospores: Flagellated (motile) and on germination gives rise to new plants

question: Match the following:
column_II: Fusion of two gametes dissimilar in size
Fusion between one large, non-motile female gamete and a smaller, motile male gamete
Fusion of two gametes similar in size

answer.Isogamous reproduction: Fusion of two gametes similar in size
answer.Anisogamous reproduction: Fusion of two gametes dissimilar in size
answer.Oogamous reproduction: Fusion between one large, non-motile female gamete and a smaller, motile male gamete
